summary: This is an email chain from September 6, 2019, forwarding a query from Washington Post reporter Matt Zapotosky about Jeffrey Epstein. Zapotosky inquires about an unreported phone call Epstein allegedly made from jail the Friday before his death, noting there is no recording as expected. The recipient declines comment.

persons.name: Matt Zapotosky
persons.context: Washington Post reporter who sent an email inquiry about an unreported phone call Jeffrey Epstein allegedly made from jail before his death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the inquiry; the email references his alleged phone call from jail before his apparent suicide.

events.title: Washington Post Inquiry on Epstein Phone Call
events.description: Washington Post reporter Matt Zapotosky sends an email inquiry about an alleged phone call Jeffrey Epstein made from jail the Friday before his death, noting the absence of a recording.

events.title: Epstein's Death in Jail
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein apparently killed himself in jail; the email references this event and an alleged phone call he made beforehand.

keyFacts: A Washington Post reporter inquired about an alleged phone call Jeffrey Epstein made from jail the Friday before his death.
The reporter noted that, for unclear reasons, there was no recording of this call as there should have been.
The recipient of the inquiry declined to comment on the matter.
The correspondence highlights media scrutiny and potential gaps in record-keeping surrounding Epstein's time in custody before his death.
